FRS_Method: GPS CARRIER PHASE STATIC RELATIVE POSITION

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
G&C Foods, Inc. provides refrigeration storage for fresh and frozen foods.  The frozen food is stored in "Controlled Atmosphere" ("CA") rooms.  In CA storage, the temperature and humidity are controlled in order to keep the frozen food in appropriate conditions for human consumption.  



G&C Foods, Inc. utilizes anhydrous ammonia as a refrigerant in its closed loop mechanical refrigeration plant ["ammonia refrigeration system" or "ammonia refrigeration process"]. Whenever the term "ammonia" appears in this document, it is understood to mean refrigerant grade anhydrous ammonia.  The amount of anhydrous ammonia at the Facility is above applicable thresholds of quantity under the Process Safety Management (PSM/RMP)  and Risk Management Program (RMP)  regulations.  This facility has responded to these federal regulations by developing this PSM/RMP Document, which summarizes the facility's compliance efforts.  Using a systematic approach, the process technology and design, process changes, operational, maintenance and non-routine activities and procedures, emergency preparedness plans, training programs, and other elements that affect the regulated process have been considered by the facility in its evaluation.  By merging the program requirements as mandated by these two sets of regulations, G&C Foods, Inc. has attempted to achieve concurrent compliance with both the PSM and RMP regulations. 



The ammonia refrigeration system has a number of safety features to prevent the release of ammonia including:

o    Redundancy Systems - for example, if a piece of equipment (e.g., compressor, condenser) fails the equipment will shut-down, and the monitoring system will tell back-up equipment to start-up.

o    State of the Art monitoring system that includes remote observation of refrigeration parameters, 24 hour/7 day remote alarm system.  If equipment shuts-down, the equipment will try to restart, if it cannot restart a message is sent to the primary computer monitoring system and

via telephone (data lines) to refrigeration operators and the safety manager.

o    On-site emergency power system.

o    King valve will shut-down if there is a loss of power.



The Facility is not aware of any available facility records that indicate that accidental releases have occurred in the past five years that have resulted in deaths, injuries or significant property damage on-site, or known off-site deaths, injuries, evacuations, sheltering in-place, property damage or environmental damage.



An updated Risk Management Plan is prepared and submitted to the USEPA every 5 years as required.  This version of the RMP was completed in compliance with 40 CFR 68 Subpart G.  This submittal included the required Executive Summary, RMP and Certification.  

.
